document.heading: Successor in Interest to a Gasoline Products Marketing Agreement Act of 1983

history.narrative: Law 5-45, the “Successor in Interest to a Gasoline Products Marketing Agreement Act of 1983,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 5-12, which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Environmental Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 20, 1983 and October 4, 1983, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 21, 1983, it was assigned Act No. 5-71 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
